newsitem.title: USA: Disney shuffles executives at TV unit.
newsitem.headline: Disney shuffles executives at TV unit.

text.p: Walt Disney Co Wednesday named Walter Liss chairman of Buena Vista Television, replacing Randy Reiss, who resigned.

In a statement, Disney said Liss, who had been president and general manager of WABC-TV, the ABC-owned station in New York, would report to ABC Inc President Robert Iger. Liss will oversee Buena Vista Television and the Pay Television unit.
Disney acquired Capital Cities/ABC last year for $19 billion.

Reiss, who had been in charge of television units as executive vice president for Walt Disney Television & Telecommunications, said he was resigning because of Disney's decision to restructure ABC's international television and broadcast divisions.
"After many months of earnest conversations, the new opportunities were not sufficiently challenging for me to remain at the company," Reiss said.

Buena Vista Television distributes programs directly to the syndicated television market, including "Live with Regis and Kathie Lee," "Siskel & Ebert" and "Bill Nye, the Science Guy," as well as Disney-produced movies and off-network series, such as "Home Improvement" and "Ellen."
The Pay Television unit licenses rights to the studio's feature films to pay cable television services and to pay-per-view providers.
Liss, who was named to head WABC-TV in 1987, joined Capital Cities Communications in 1971.
